item.title: Emergent Convergence in Multi-Agent LLM Annotation
item.description: arXiv:2512.00047v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) are increasingly deployed in collaborative settings, yet little is known about how they coordinate when treated as black-box agents. We simulate 7500 multi-agent, multi-round discussions in an inductive coding task, genera...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> prompting, LLM, arxiv, prompt, alignment | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Minimal-Edit Instruction Tuning for Low-Resource Indic GEC
item.description: arXiv:2512.00219v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Grammatical error correction for Indic languages faces limited supervision, diverse scripts, and rich morphology. We propose an augmentation-free setup that uses instruction-tuned large language models and conservative decoding. A 12B GEMMA 3 model is...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> RAG, instruction, vision, arxiv, prompt | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: EduEval: A Hierarchical Cognitive Benchmark for Evaluating Large Language Models in Chinese Education
item.description: arXiv:2512.00290v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) demonstrate significant potential for educational applications. However, their unscrutinized deployment poses risks to educational standards, underscoring the need for rigorous evaluation. We introduce EduEval, a comprehen...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> prompting, zero-shot, LLM, arxiv, prompt | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Measuring What LLMs Think They Do: SHAP Faithfulness and Deployability on Financial Tabular Classification
item.description: arXiv:2512.00163v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) have attracted significant attention for classification tasks, offering a flexible alternative to trusted classical machine learning models like LightGBM through zero-shot prompting. However, their reliability for structur...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> prompting, zero-shot, LLM, study, arxiv | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles handbook inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.
item.description: "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy.
